column1: Art Institute of Chicago////My fave work in this museum is "The Rock" by Peter Blume. On this visit
column2: I discovered the painting was commissioned by Kaufmann for Falling Water to commemorate the Proletariat. A great architect. A great architectural masterpiece. A great piece of artwork. And if you've visited Falling Water
column3: you'll know about the intact rock left unmoved at exactly the right height and distance to sit on in front of the fireplace confirming the absolute genius of Wright. Cheers!
